comment: So incredibly boring, and he will take so many points off of the engineering drawings for such tiny mistakes like if he doesn't like how you drew one of your letters and doesn't let you use straight edges so it takes forever to draw everything

Drawings took forever because straight edges weren't allowed. He gave me 0s on all the drawings because I used the wrong graph paper or wrong type of scanner. All my lines were clearly visible and had the right measurements. He didn't let me resubmit anything.

I honestly have no idea why the ratings are like this. It was a very straightforward class and as long as you follow the assignment instructions you should have zero problem maintaining a high A. I make small mistakes on some drawings and he only takes off a point or two. If you have any common sense at all you should easily have a good grade.

Very tough grader especially on hand drafting which we did for about half the semester. I would spend a few hours or more on each assignment and if there were 1 or 2 small mistakes he would take off 10 or 20 points. He took off 10 points on one assignment because I drew one letter wrong.

Harsh grader, boring lectures, stupid quizzes, expensive materials for singular use. We didn't start CAD until week 6. We cant use the expensive scales we bought for any assignments. Terrible class. Take any other professor.

I have a Solidworks CWSA and made C's on all his assignments. Terrible professor for an intro graphics class he expects zero mistakes. 2 SMALL mistakes brought my grade down to a 60. Requires you to purchase several scales but we only used them for 1 quiz. all the hand drawings are done 100% free hand without the use of the scales.

Good Luck trying to learn. Most of the class shared (outside of class) that we thought he was a bad teacher and we were doing not so well. Dropped at the midterm. 1st part is pretty bad good luck, second part is a drawing. you spend up until week 8 doing hand drawings. He introduces SolidWorks but you do almost everything on your own.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Where can I start? I was near the top of my school coming into college, and even I struggled in his class. Most of his presentations do not go over what is in the quiz at all, he just tells you to read. And even if you do, he cherry-picks tiny details to put into his quizzes. Do not take his class unless you want to decimate your freshman GPA.

If I could give this professor negative  stars I would. Everything that you have read from other posts is 100% true. He will fail you over the slightest mistake and will deduct points multiple times for the same mistake. He is a truly awful professor if you want to learn graphics choose someone else. You have been warned.

I took Professor Blount a year ago, and I'm not happy. He focused too much on hand-drawing and not enough on Solidworks. This issue was so bad, he completely neglected to teach us about assemblies. Because of this, I'm now unprepared for my higher level engineering classes. He has the potential to be a great professor, but I can't recommend him.

He's good at teaching but seems to be overly focused on hand drawings and lettering. The class could certainly have been improved by focusing more on SolidWorks. His grading is very particular, like all graphics professors, but he is fair. Attention to detail is as critical in his class as it will be in follow on engineering courses.
Horrible Professor, does not care whatsoever. Do not take this professor, there are better options. Inconsistent grader, Would not recommend.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Extraordinarily difficult class. Most other classes under edg 1211 actually teach the material and don't grade as hard as this guy. Make a mistake? good luck getting an A. The assignments are very difficult to achieve an A on, simply because if you do one part incorrectly, your grade drops significantly. I would highly recommend anyone to NOT take

Professor Blount ranks among one of the worst graphics teachers as KSU. He take days to respond to emails if at all, gives no help on assignments, is an inconsistent grader and a very jaded and hard to please professor. WARNING: DO NOT TAKE HIM OR AUBREY WINSOR. ignore my warning at your own risk!!!
This professor gives all or nothing grades... You either get a 100 or a 0... Do not take this class.

So, I had this class online, Professor Blount is not a great communicator, at least with his online class. He is short and does not help. When using Solidworks, we have had nothing but problems and when we addressed these problems he does not help and simply says it is our personal error. I know how to use AutoCAD, but Solidworks is finicky. nooo!!

Very tough grader for an intro level class. Will drop your assignments by a letter grade if you make a single mistake (such as barely having a part of a letter out of bounds). Keep up with his emails every day or you'll end up failing the class. His online class does provide lecture videos, but they are as dry and boring as being at the DMV.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Took it during the summer, after failing with Aubrey Winsor TWICE, and made an A. This guy actually teaches and goes over the material very slowly and answer whatever questions you may have. Great professor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Hybrid; lots of recorded how-to's. Hand drawings are tough, but SolidWorks is a breeze if you pay attention. No pop quizzes. Easy A if you do and know the material.

This professor expects you to already have the basics down. He's probably the most boring professor I've ever had and gives barely any feedback nor help. No chance to bring up the grade. Terrible lecturer. Has no passion for his subject and feels like he doesn't even want to be here. Had to drop the course, thankfully changed majors though.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Expects you to know Solidworks going in, and doesn't give clear feedback on hand-drawings except red lines everywhere. Very few opportunities to bring grade back up if you start to fall behind and doesn't clearly tell you what's going to be on the mid-term or final.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This man expects you to already know how to use SolidWorks even though it's an introductory class. Would NOT recommend.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.
